Study on Physical Activity Mobile App
Department of Information Systems and Analytics
Project title: A Personalized Technology-Based Intervention for Physical Activity
Professor TEO Hock Hai, Provost\'s Chair Professor
Department of Information Systems and Analytics,
School of Computing, National University of Singapore (NUS)
Dr.TAN Swee Lin, Sharon, Senior Lecturer, Department of Information Systems and Analytics,
School of Computing, National University of Singapore (NUS)
ONG Zhi Quan, Ph.D. Candidate, Department of Information Systems and Analytics,
School of Computing, National University of Singapore (NUS)
1. I have agreed to take part in the above study.

2. I have received a copy of this information sheet (PIS) that explains the use of my data and results in this study. I understand its contents and agree to donate my data for the use of this study. I understand that the wireless activity tracker\'s manufacturer will have access to my physical activity data.
3. I can withdraw from the study at any point of time by informing the Principal Investigator and all my data will be discarded.
4. I will not have any financial benefits that result from this study
5. I understand that my personal data will be discarded upon completion of this research. However, my anonymised data may be used in future stages of the research.

6. I will be responsible for providing due care and security for any loaned devices(if applicable) until it is returned to the research team at the end of this study. If I damage/misplace the wireless activity tracker, a replace tracker will be issued to me and I will not receive reimbursement. I understand that for repeat damages/misplacements, I will be dropped from the study and I will forfeit all reimbursements.
Study on Physical Activity Mobile App
Thank you for your informed consent to participate in the study involving the use of the physical activity mobile app.

We estimate that the following survey questionnaire will require 30 minutes to complete. There are no known risks of completing the survey. To receive reimbursement, you need to complete this questionnaire (i.e. all questions must be answered). Please answer all questions as honestly as possible.

Your identity and responses for this questionnaire will remain confidential and anonymous. We have taken all reasonable measures to protect your identity and responses. The questions in the questionnaire do not ask you to reveal any personally identifying information aside from your email address (ideally your NUSNET email) and matriculation number. Your email address will be kept for matching purposes only, and your matriculation number is obtained for administrative purposes as we will loan you a physical activity tracker. Additionally, your responses will be digitally coded and stored in a private password-protected server hosted at NUS School of Computing. It will be accessed by only authorized research staff. Personal data will be discarded upon completion of this research. Aggregated data collected from this questionnaire will be used to help us understand the effect of the mobile app that is used in this study.
If you require additional information or have questions, feel free to contact us using the emails listed in your Participant Information Sheet (PIS).

If you are not satisfied with the conduct of the study, you may report (anonymously if you wish) to a staff member of the National University of Singapore Institutional Review Board (IRB) (Attn: Dr. Chan Tuck Wai, at telephone 6516 1234 or email at irb@nus.edu.sg).
Thank you for completing the survey questionnaire!
Kindly not that the features of iMovin\' may change depanding on your submitted reponse to this questionnaire.

Use the dashboard to monitor your physical activity over time. Your daily statistics are shown on the top portion of the page. The graph in the middle shows your physical activity for the past week. A bar in the graph that is filled indicates that you have met your set plan for the day. Toggle between data for steps, calories, duration and distance using the buttons below the graph. Check out the other functions of iMovin below.

Earn points and badges for moving! You can receive badges for achieving specific milestones such as steps or duration. Click on each badge to see its details such as the number of points it is worth and the number of times you have earned it. Each challenge lasts for 30 days. You will be participating in the challenge with other users, so try to aim for first place!
You can create a new post by filling in the textbox, or upload a photo from your mobile device.
Check out new articles about exercising by clicking on each article. The articles will change regularly, so come back for new articles!

Create an exercise plan for your daily steps! Either set a default plan provided by iMovin, or create a new personal plan by pressing ‘New Custom’. You can modify or delete all custom plans. Plans can only be modified on Mondays.

Check out how you are faring in your exercise plans for your daily steps! Each day in the calendar shows how close you are to completing your set plan. Click on each day to see more details. You can also change the plan you are monitoring by pressing ‘Change Plan’.
Interact with other users via the Forum! Start a new forum thread, like threads posted by other users or post comments on the threads.
Access the messages sent from iMovin’ here!
Get rewarded for moving! Earn points, redeem prizes! You can also monitor your progress towards an available reward!
